results.title: Motorcycle safety tips
results.brief_description: Points out the special problems motorcycle riders have and how motorists, cyclists and pedestrians can cooperate for the safety of all. It is aimed at both the beginner and the experienced rider. Discusses how to check out a bike for safety, how to dress, defensive driving, how to develop driving skills, and how to increase awareness and thereby chances of survival. Suitable for upper secondary level.
results.description: Points out the special problems motorcycle riders have and how motorists, cyclists and pedestrians can cooperate for the safety of all. results.title: Motor vehicle trades
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Deals with the trade of the panel beater, and also shows the work of the vehicle trimmer and the vehicle painter. Discusses apprenticeship details and training required.

results.title: Motor mechanic
results.creator_credit: Career Productions and Mutual Film Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Is this your career series”.
Designed to give the intending mechanic some idea of the specialised work involved in the career of a modern automotive mechanic. The technical training required is discussed.

results.title: Motor mania (K)
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Jack Kinney
results.brief_description: A Disney animated film about road safety and the change that takes place in an average individual when they sit behind the wheel of a car. The pleasant, courteous Mr Walker becomes the fiendish Mr Wheeler, forgetting how it feels to be a pedestrian and stubbornly blind to his failings as a driver.
results.description: A Disney animated film about road safety and the change that takes place in an average individual when they sit behind the wheel of a car. The pleasant, courteous Mr Walker becomes the fiendish Mr Wheeler, forgetting how it feels to be a pedestrian and stubbornly blind to his failings as a driver.

The pleasant, courteous Mr Walker becomes the fiendish Mr Wheeler, forgetting how it feels to be a pedestrian and stubbornly blind to his failings as a driver.
